1|#!/bin/zsh
     2|
     3|# Text Color Variables
     4|GREEN='\033[32m' # Green
     5|YELLOW='\033[33m' # Yellow
     6|RED='\033[31m' # Red
     7|CLEAR='\033[0m'  # Clear color and formatting
     8|
     9|# Emojis for progress indication
    10|EMOJIS=("🚀" "⏳" "🔄" "📦" "✅" "🛠️" "📊" "🔧" "🚧")
    11|
    12|# Logfile setup
    13|LOGFILE="update-check-log-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S).log"
    14|
    15|# Function to print with emoji
    16|print_with_emoji() {
    17|    local msg=$1
    18|    local emoji=${EMOJIS[RANDOM % ${#EMOJIS[@]}]}
    19|    echo -e "${emoji} ${GREEN}${msg}${CLEAR}" | tee -a "$LOGFILE"
    20|}
    21|
    22|# Function to print warning message
    23|print_warning() {
    24|    local msg=$1
    25|    echo -e "${YELLOW}${msg}${CLEAR}" | tee -a "$LOGFILE"
    26|}
    27|
    28|# Function to print error message
    29|print_error() {
    30|    local msg=$1
    31|    echo -e "${RED}${msg}${CLEAR}" | tee -a "$LOGFILE"
    32|}
    33|
    34|# Function to log and print update lists
    35|log_output () {
    36|    local output=$1
    37|    if [ -n "$output" ]; then
    38|        echo "$output" | tee -a "$LOGFILE"
    39|    else
    40|        echo "No updates available" | tee -a "$LOGFILE"
    41|    fi
    42|}
    43|
    44|check_brew_updates() {
    45|    if ! which brew &>/dev/null; then
    46|        print_error "Brew is not installed or not in PATH"
    47|        return
    48|    fi
    49|
    50|    print_with_emoji "Checking Brew Formulae updates"
    51|    outdated_formulae=$(brew outdated 2>&1)
    52|    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    53|        print_error "Error checking Brew Formulae updates: $outdated_formulae"
    54|    else
    55|        log_output "$outdated_formulae"
    56|    fi
    57|
    58|    print_with_emoji "Checking Brew Casks updates"
    59|    outdated_casks=$(brew outdated --cask 2>&1)
    60|    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    61|        print_error "Error checking Brew Casks updates: $outdated_casks"
    62|    else
    63|        log_output "$outdated_casks"
    64|    fi
    65|}
    66|
    67|check_pip_updates() {
    68|    local python_bin=$1
    69|    local pip_bin=$2
    70|
    71|    if ! which $pip_bin &>/dev/null; then
    72|        print_error "$pip_bin is not installed or not in PATH"
    73|        return
    74|    fi
    75|
    76|    print_with_emoji "Checking $pip_bin packages updates"
    77|    outdated_packages=$($pip_bin list --outdated 2>&1 | awk 'NR>2 {print $1}')
    78|    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    79|        print_error "Error checking $pip_bin packages updates: $outdated_packages"
    80|    else
    81|        log_output "$outdated_packages"
    82|    fi
    83|}
    84|

     1|# 📁 Documents Directory Content-Aware Organization System
     2|
     3|**Specialized for 43GB Documents Directory with Advanced Intelligence**
     4|
     5|---
     6|
     7|## 🎯 **System Overview**
     8|
     9|This is a **specialized content-aware organization system** designed specifically for your 43GB Documents directory. It combines AI-powered content analysis with business intelligence to create the most sophisticated document management system possible.
    10|
    11|### **What Makes This System Unique for Documents:**
    12|
    13|1. **📊 Size-Aware Processing** - Optimized for handling 43GB of content efficiently
    14|2. **🧠 Content Intelligence** - Analyzes document content, not just filenames
    15|3. **🏢 Business Context Detection** - Recognizes AvatarArts, QuantumForgeLabs, GPTJunkie content
    16|4. **📁 Document Type Recognition** - Understands PDFs, presentations, spreadsheets, code
    17|5. **🎯 Priority-Based Organization** - High-priority documents get prime locations
    18|6. **💾 Space Optimization** - Eliminates duplicates and archives old content
    19|
    20|---
    21|
    22|## 🚀 **Advanced Features for Documents**
    23|
    24|### **1. Document-Specific Content Analysis**
    25|```python
    26|# Analyzes documents for:
    27|- Business relevance (contracts, proposals, reports)
    28|- Technical complexity (code, documentation, projects)
    29|- Creative value (designs, portfolios, presentations)
    30|- File type intelligence (PDF, PPT, XLS, DOC, etc.)
    31|- Size-based prioritization (large files handled specially)
    32|- Context determination (which business entity)
    33|```
    34|
    35|### **2. Intelligent Document Categorization**
    36|- **Business Documents** - Contracts, invoices, proposals, reports
    37|- **Creative Assets** - Designs, portfolios, brand materials
    38|- **Technical Projects** - Code, documentation, development files
    39|- **Personal Documents** - Resume, certificates, personal notes
    40|- **Media Assets** - Images, videos, presentations
    41|- **Data Files** - Spreadsheets, databases, exports
    42|
    43|### **3. Size-Optimized Processing**
    44|- **Large File Handling** - Files >100MB moved to special directory
    45|- **Batch Processing** - Processes files in batches to avoid memory issues
    46|- **Progress Monitoring** - Real-time progress updates for large operations

code_blocks.code: Wrote contents to /Users/steven/documents/script/docs/source/categories/python_development.rst

1|#!/bin/zsh
     2|
     3|# Text Color Variables
     4|GREEN='\033[32m' # Green
     5|YELLOW='\033[33m' # Yellow
     6|RED='\033[31m' # Red
     7|CLEAR='\033[0m'  # Clear color and formatting
     8|
     9|# Emojis for progress indication
    10|EMOJIS=("🚀" "⏳" "🔄" "📦" "✅" "🛠️" "📊" "🔧" "🚧")
    11|
    12|# Logfile setup
    13|LOGFILE="update-check-log-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S).log"
    14|
    15|# Function to print with emoji
    16|print_with_emoji() {
    17|    local msg=$1
    18|    local emoji=${EMOJIS[RANDOM % ${#EMOJIS[@]}]}
    19|    echo -e "${emoji} ${GREEN}${msg}${CLEAR}" | tee -a "$LOGFILE"
    20|}
    21|
    22|# Function to print warning message
    23|print_warning() {
    24|    local msg=$1
    25|    echo -e "${YELLOW}${msg}${CLEAR}" | tee -a "$LOGFILE"
    26|}
    27|
    28|# Function to print error message
    29|print_error() {
    30|    local msg=$1
    31|    echo -e "${RED}${msg}${CLEAR}" | tee -a "$LOGFILE"
    32|}
    33|
    34|# Function to log and print update lists
    35|log_output () {
    36|    local output=$1
    37|    if [ -n "$output" ]; then
    38|        echo "$output" | tee -a "$LOGFILE"
    39|    else
    40|        echo "No updates available" | tee -a "$LOGFILE"
    41|    fi
    42|}
    43|
    44|check_brew_updates() {
    45|    if ! which brew &>/dev/null; then
    46|        print_error "Brew is not installed or not in PATH"
    47|        return
    48|    fi
    49|
    50|    print_with_emoji "Checking Brew Formulae updates"
    51|    outdated_formulae=$(brew outdated 2>&1)
    52|    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    53|        print_error "Error checking Brew Formulae updates: $outdated_formulae"
    54|    else
    55|        log_output "$outdated_formulae"
    56|    fi
    57|
    58|    print_with_emoji "Checking Brew Casks updates"
    59|    outdated_casks=$(brew outdated --cask 2>&1)
    60|    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    61|        print_error "Error checking Brew Casks updates: $outdated_casks"
    62|    else
    63|        log_output "$outdated_casks"
    64|    fi
    65|}
    66|
    67|check_pip_updates() {
    68|    local python_bin=$1
    69|    local pip_bin=$2
    70|
    71|    if ! which $pip_bin &>/dev/null; then
    72|        print_error "$pip_bin is not installed or not in PATH"
    73|        return
    74|    fi
    75|
    76|    print_with_emoji "Checking $pip_bin packages updates"
    77|    outdated_packages=$($pip_bin list --outdated 2>&1 | awk 'NR>2 {print $1}')
    78|    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    79|        print_error "Error checking $pip_bin packages updates: $outdated_packages"
    80|    else
    81|        log_output "$outdated_packages"
    82|    fi
    83|}
    84|
    85|check_conda_updates() {
    86|    if ! which conda &>/dev/null; then
    87|        print_error "Conda is not installed or not in PATH"
    88|        return
    89|    fi
    90|
    91|    print_with_emoji "Checking Conda updates"
    92|    conda_updates=$(conda search --outdated 2>&1)
    93|    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    94|        print_error "Error checking Conda updates: $conda_updates"
    95|    else
    96|        log_output "$conda_updates"
    97|    fi
    98|}
    99|
   100|check_npm_updates() {

   140|    else
   141|        log_output "$rustup_updates"
   142|    fi

   144|

code_blocks.code:
<search_result path="DOCUMENTS_ORGANIZATION_OVERVIEW.md" startLine="1" endLine="251">
     1|# 📁 Documents Directory Content-Aware Organization System
     2|
     3|**Specialized for 43GB Documents Directory with Advanced Intelligence**
     4|
     5|---
     6|
     7|## 🎯 **System Overview**
     8|
     9|This is a **specialized content-aware organization system** designed specifically for your 43GB Documents directory. It combines AI-powered content analysis with business intelligence to create the most sophisticated document management system possible.
    10|
    11|### **What Makes This System Unique for Documents:**
    12|
    13|1. **📊 Size-Aware Processing** - Optimized for handling 43GB of content efficiently
    14|2. **🧠 Content Intelligence** - Analyzes document content, not just filenames
    15|3. **🏢 Business Context Detection** - Recognizes AvatarArts, QuantumForgeLabs, GPTJunkie content
    16|4. **📁 Document Type Recognition** - Understands PDFs, presentations, spreadsheets, code
    17|5. **🎯 Priority-Based Organization** - High-priority documents get prime locations
    18|6. **💾 Space Optimization** - Eliminates duplicates and archives old content
    19|
    20|---
    21|
    22|## 🚀 **Advanced Features for Documents**
    23|
    24|### **1. Document-Specific Content Analysis**
    25|```python
    26|# Analyzes documents for:
    27|- Business relevance (contracts, proposals, reports)
    28|- Technical complexity (code, documentation, projects)
    29|- Creative value (designs, portfolios, presentations)
    30|- File type intelligence (PDF, PPT, XLS, DOC, etc.)
    31|- Size-based prioritization (large files handled specially)
    32|- Context determination (which business entity)
    33|```
    34|
    35|### **2. Intelligent Document Categorization**
    36|- **Business Documents** - Contracts, invoices, proposals, reports
    37|- **Creative Assets** - Designs, portfolios, brand materials
    38|- **Technical Projects** - Code, documentation, development files
    39|- **Personal Documents** - Resume, certificates, personal notes
    40|- **Media Assets** - Images, videos, presentations
    41|- **Data Files** - Spreadsheets, databases, exports
    42|
    43|### **3. Size-Optimized Processing**
    44|- **Large File Handling** - Files >100MB moved to special directory
    45|- **Batch Processing** - Processes files in batches to avoid memory issues
    46|- **Progress Monitoring** - Real-time progress updates for large operations
   ...
   118|│   ├── references/           # Reference materials
   119|│   ├── templates/            # Document templates
   120|│   └── guides_manuals/       # How-to guides
   121|└── LARGE_FILES/               # Files >100MB for special handling
   122|```
   123|
   124|---
   125|
   126|## 🧠 **Content-Aware Intelligence**
   127|
   128|### **Document Type Recognition**
   129|**Business Documents:**
   130|- PDFs, Word docs, presentations
   131|- Contracts, proposals, reports
   132|- Financial documents, invoices
   133|- Marketing materials, strategies
   134|
   135|**Technical Documents:**
   136|- Code files, documentation
   137|- Project specifications, guides
   138|- Technical reports, analysis
   139|- Development tools, utilities
   140|
   141|**Creative Documents:**
   142|- Design files, portfolios
   143|- Brand materials, templates
   144|- Visual content, presentations
   145|- Creative project files
   146|
   147|**Personal Documents:**
   148|- Resume, CV, certificates
   149|- Personal notes, journals
   150|- Education materials, learning
   151|- Private documents, family
   152|
   153|### **Size-Based Intelligence**
   154|- **Large Files (>100MB)** - Moved to special LARGE_FILES directory
   155|- **Medium Files (10-100MB)** - Organized by content type
   156|- **Small Files (<10MB)** - Organized by priority and context
   157|- **Tiny Files (<1MB)** - Grouped and archived efficiently
   158|
   159|### **Priority Scoring System**
   160|Every document receives a score based on:
   161|
   162|1. **Business Relevance (0-10)**
   163|   - Contracts, proposals, client work
   164|   - Marketing materials, business plans
   165|   - Financial documents, reports
   166|
   167|2. **Technical Complexity (0-10)**
   168|   - Code documentation, technical specs
   169|   - Development projects, tools
   170|   - Technical reports, analysis
   171|
   172|3. **Creative Value (0-10)**
   173|   - Design files, portfolios
   174|   - Brand materials, creative content
   175|   - Visual presentations, artwork
   176|
   177|4. **File Size Factor**
   178|   - Large files get higher priority
   179|   - Important documents prioritized
   180|   - Archive candidates identified
   181|
   182|---
   183|

   185|
   186|### **File Discovery Time**
   187|- **Before:** 2-5 minutes to find specific documents
   188|- **After:** 10-30 seconds with content-aware search
